title.narrative: ENGAGED ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: Adolescents mobilized and with increased knowledge and opportunities to participate in public forums of decision-making processes., which contributes to Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, engaged citizens, including boys, girls and families, millennials, individual donors and private sector partners, are driving public action for the realization of children's rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Adolescents mobilized and with increased knowledge and opportunities to participate in public forums of decision-making processes.

description.narrative: A total of 39,102 adolescents were engaged in life skills activities and decision-making public forums on their rights in three geographic areas affected by inequalities: The Semiarid, the Amazon and in low-income communities of large urban centers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of municipalities participating in the municipal Seal that have created a NUCA (Adolescent Citizenship Group)
